title: Browns trade QB Pickett to Raiders for '26 pick
content: The Raiders acquired Kenny Pickett from the Browns on Monday, giving them an experienced backup for Geno Smith after Aidan O'Connell was injured, and leaving Cleveland with rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders behind starter Joe Flacco.

title: Raleigh joins Mantle in record books with 50th HR
content: Cal Raleigh hit his 50th homer, extending his major league record for a catcher and joining Mickey Mantle as the only switch-hitters to reach that mark.

title: NCAA, Venmo partner vs. college athlete abuse
content: A new partnership between the NCAA and Venmo to combat abuse and harassment of college athletes, announced Tuesday, includes a reporting hotline.

title: Cards' Contreras ejected, hits own coach with bat
content: Following a called third strike in the seventh inning Monday, first baseman Willson Contreras threw a bat that mistakenly hit his own coach and tossed gum on the field after he was ejected in the St. Louis Cardinals' 7-6 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Bengals give star DE Hendrickson big pay bump
content: The Bengals and Trey Hendrickson reached agreement Monday on a $14 million raise for this year, boosting his 2025 salary to $30 million, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: QB-heavy Giants cut 'Cutlets' DeVito
content: The Giants will begin the season with three quarterbacks after releasing fourth-stringer Tommy DeVito, sources told ESPN.

title: Courtesy of Nike, Clark gets a logo all her own
content: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark, the 2024 No. 1 WNBA draft pick, was introduced Monday as Nike's newest signature athlete, which entails the launch of a new signature logo, a collection of sportswear and apparel -- and eventually a signature sneaker.

title: Venus shines in US Open return despite 3-set loss
content: Venus Williams, 45, played her first Grand Slam match in two years at the US Open on Monday, displaying some big serves and powerful groundstrokes before losing 6-3, 2-6, 6-1 to Karolina Muchova.

title: 💈Alcaraz's US Open haircut turns heads
content: When Alcaraz arrived at the US Open practice courts on Tuesday, his full head of hair was missing, replaced with a buzz cut.

title: Live updates on NFL cut-down day: Latest news as teams trim their rosters
content: We're following releases, trades, signings and other intriguing moves for all 32 NFL teams before the 4 p.m. ET roster cut-down deadline.

title: Reranking every MLB farm system from 1 to 30
content: The busiest time of the year for adding prospects has passed. Here's how every organization stacks up now.

title: 'I can't go out like that': How Travis Kelce has prepared for what could be his final season
content: Following his worst year as a pro in 2024, Kelce has revamped his body and mind for one more shot at Super Bowl glory.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: The MVP race heats up as Aces hold steady at No. 2
content: A'ja Wilson has led Las Vegas on an 11-game winning streak to clinch the league's second playoff spot.

title: Runaway MVPs, ROY races? Expert predictions for every major 2025-26 NBA award
content: Can Jokic claim a fourth MVP? Which rookie will impress? Our NBA Summer Forecast panel reveals its award predictions for the 2025-26 season.

title: Bo Nix, Calvin Ridley among Eric Moody's top draft targets
content: Eric Moody lists the players he's most excited about drafting this season, including some late-round targets.

title: Trey Hendrickson is latest Bengals star to get paid; now they have to win
content: Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins and Hendrickson all landed new deals this offseason, and with that come expectations.

title: Striker moves prompting more striker moves: How top Premier League clubs net out
content: This transfer window has seen a bunch of Premier League strikers move, but they all just sorted of swapped teams. Has all this spending accomplished anything?

title: Madrid's No. 10 jersey taking Mbappé to next level
content: Kylian Mbappé's scoring has never been in question, but now he does the dirty work under a new coach.

title: After skipping Gold Cup, Musah has big plans for USMNT in a World Cup year
content: United States international Yunus Musah speaks to ESPN's James Olley about his future at AC Milan and his high hopes for next year's World Cup hosts.

title: Way-Too-Early Bracketology: Is this (finally) the year of the Big Ten?
content: For a change, the Big Ten has both quantity and quality to send to the Dance. Can its 25-year title drought finally end?

title: College football betting: Breaking down the Heisman and national champion odds, top bets
content: Pamela Maldonado tracks the odds to win the Heisman Trophy and the national championship and shares bets that offer the best value.

title: NFL: Four keys to help you navigate the 2025 season, plus early picks
content: Ben Solak looks at bets to take advantage of -- and ones to avoid -- and offers his strategy and early plays.

title: The best 100 players in the NFL this season: Our experts' ranking, starting with four QBs in the top five
content: We predicted the top players in 2025. How many Eagles are ranked? Is Patrick Mahomes still No. 1? Where does Myles Garrett land?

title: Who were NFL Rank's 10 worst snubs? Scouts and execs ID the misses
content: Only 100 players can make the player rankings. Here are 10 more who league insiders felt should have been there.

title: MLB predictions: What will Judge's WAR be? 61 homers for Raleigh? How many K's for Skubal?
content: Some players are on pace for incredible final numbers. We asked our MLB experts to decide who will keep it up -- and who will lose steam down the stretch run.

title: Where Raleigh's catcher HR record ranks among all-time surprising power seasons
content: The Mariners slugger made long ball history. Here's how his year stacks up with other shocking breakouts.

title: V of K-pop group BTS snaps photo with Shohei Ohtani, delivers Dodgers first pitch
content: V of K-pop sensation BTS threw a strike for the ceremonial first pitch before the Dodgers' game on Monday.

title: From the court to the villa: How Pepe Garcia found his way to 'Love Island'
content: The former Cal State Fullerton guard and international pro found himself back in the spotlight through "Love Island".

title: Way-too-early UFC at the White House fight card
content: Dana White says a UFC event at the White House is "going to happen" in 2026, so let's take a early look at building a fight card fit for the venue.

title: Boxing divisional rankings:  Did Baraou's win land him in the junior middleweight top 10?
content: Abass Baraou and Yoenis Tellez put on a show during a slow boxing weekend. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Does Frances Tiafoe have momentum on his side at the US Open?
content: Tiafoe is playing at his favorite tournament -- in front of crowds that adore him. This might be the year he gets past the US Open semifinals.

title: NHL draft prospect watch list: Who joins Gavin McKenna?
content: With the Hlinka-Gretzky Cup complete, draft season is here. Here are the top skaters to watch for next June.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make move for Martinez
content: Girona right back Arnau Martínez is on the radar of Arsenal. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Which prospects may still matter for the rest of the 2025 season?
content: As the 2025 season enters the homestretch, let's examine some exciting new names we weren't talking about in April.

title: Fantasy baseball pickups: Power, speed and a must-add returning ace
content: Here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers returning from injury.

title: ‘Strategic shock’: Trump’s tariffs to hit 66% of India’s exports to US; China, Vietnam set to gain
content: Starting August 27, 2025, the US will impose 50% tariffs on $60.2 billion worth of Indian exports, impacting textiles, gems, and furniture. This move is projected to significantly reduce India's exports to the US, potentially benefiting countries like China and Vietnam.

title: J&K flash floods: 6 killed as landslide hits Vaishno Devi shrine route; yatra suspended
content: Heavy monsoon rains triggered a landslide on the Mata Vaishno Devi shrine route in Jammu and Kashmir, injuring at least six. The yatra has been suspended, and trains to Katra cancelled. Widespread disruption continues across the region with landslides blocking the Jammu-Srinagar highway and cloudbursts causing flash floods in Doda.

title: New BJP president: Is Shivraj Singh Chouhan leading the race? Agriculture minister responds
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan is prioritizing agricultural production and farmer income. He dismissed speculations about becoming the next BJP president. Chouhan emphasized his dedication to his ministerial duties. He aims to boost rural development and empower women through self-help groups. He sees serving farmers as a form of worship. Chouhan's focus remains on his current responsibilities in the Modi government. JP Nadda's term as BJP president was previously extended.

title: 'If need arises ... ': Navy chief on 'opening' against Pak if Op Sindoor resumes
content: Admiral Dinesh Kumar Tripathi affirmed the Indian Navy's readiness to act decisively, continuing Operation Sindoor if necessary. Speaking at the commissioning of INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri, he highlighted their role in deterring enemies and keeping Pakistan in check. Rajnath Singh commissioned the frigates, emphasizing their advanced capabilities for various missions and contribution to India's maritime security.

title: Judges vs judges over VP nominee Reddy: 56 retired judges caution peers - what they wrote in letter
content: Following Amit Shah's criticism of Justice Sudershan Reddy's Salwa Judum judgment, 56 retired judges, including former CJIs Sathasivam and Gogoi, issued a counter-statement disagreeing with the initial group of judges who defended Reddy. They urged their colleagues to avoid politically motivated statements, emphasizing that the judiciary should remain distinct from political entanglements.

title: Google abandons virtual hiring model: CEO says AI cheating unstoppable
content: Google is reintroducing in-person job interviews as CEO Sundar Pichai addresses concerns about AI-driven cheating during virtual hiring. This decision marks a shift from the remote practices adopted during the pandemic. Employees raised the issue, prompting Google to balance efficiency with the need to ensure the authenticity of the hiring process, acknowledging that competitors face similar challenges.

title: How ‘intent to return’ test is crushing Indian students' American dreams
content: Indian students face mounting hurdles in securing US F-1 visas, with just 9,906 issued between March and May 2025—a 27% drop from last year. Section 214(b) denials, rooted in proving “intent to return,” leave many dreams shattered. Beyond finances or academics, consular officers scrutinize career plans, family ties, travel history, and narratives, turning visa approval into a high-stakes test of persuasion and perception.

title: Weapons, food and living quarters: IDF dismantles 'Hamas underground tunnels' – watch
content: The IDF revealed the dismantling of Hamas's offensive tunnel routes, complete with living facilities and weapons, which were then sealed with concrete. Dozens of terrorists were reportedly eliminated during the operation, with terror infrastructure destroyed both above and below ground.

title: Asia Cup: Sunil Gavaskar hits out - ‘Focus on your country, let us worryaboutours’
content: Sunil Gavaskar has strongly criticized overseas cricketers for commenting on India's team selection, particularly Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad. The legend questioned the need for foreign voices to judge decisions made by Indian selectors, emphasizing that Indian cricket is strictly an Indian affair. He also argued that such foreign players hardly comment when it pertains to matters of their own country.

title: Salary question: Bill Gates on ‘compulsory’ interview ask; What Microsoft founder answered
content: Bill Gates shared his perspective on handling the salary expectation question during job interviews, advocating for a focus on long-term vision and stock options over immediate cash. In a 2020 mock interview, he emphasized the importance of transparency and trust, signaling confidence in the company's potential.

title: Srinagar airport brawl: Army official put on SpiceJet no fly list for 5 years
content: A senior Army official has been placed on SpiceJet's no-fly list for five years after allegedly assaulting four airline employees at Srinagar airport in July 2025. The incident occurred when staff requested payment for excess baggage. SpiceJet reports that its employees sustained severe injuries, including a spinal fracture and jaw injuries, due to the assault.

title: Videos, CCTV & conflicting claims: Noida's Nikki Bhati death case takes explosive turn
content: The Nikki Bhati murder case sees new developments. CCTV footage places Vipin, the husband, away from the house during the alleged attack. Police arrest Vipin's father and brother. Vipin claims a cylinder blast caused Nikki's injuries. Nikki's sister alleges Vipin set her on fire. Police are investigating dowry harassment and domestic violence angles. Vipin denies killing Nikki. The investigation continues.

title: Indian Navy milestone: Rajnath commissions stealth frigates INS Udaygiri and Himgiri
content: In a historic first, India's Navy commissioned two stealth frigates, INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri, built at separate shipyards, enhancing maritime capabilities. These Project 17A class warships, featuring advanced technology and significant indigenous content, signify a major boost to India's self-reliance in defence and commitment to maritime security in the Indian Ocean Region. The frigates will join the Eastern Fleet.

title: SpaceX prodigy exits: Kairan Quazi, hired by Elon Musk at 14, says ‘I felt ready’
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old former SpaceX engineer, is making a surprising move to Wall Street, joining Citadel Securities as a quantitative developer. He chose quant finance over AI labs due to its fast-paced environment and immediate impact. Quazi's unconventional path includes skipping grades and becoming SpaceX's youngest employee, now he's ready to tackle new challenges in the financial world.

title: DMK minister’s son refuses medal from BJP leader Annamalai- See video
content: During a state-level shooting competition in Pudukottai, T R B Raaja's son, Suryaa Rajaa Baalu, declined to receive a medal directly from former BJP state president K Annamalai, opting to take it with his hands.

title: Giants cut Tommy DeVito: Fan-favorite released on NFL cutdown day
content: In a surprising move on NFL cutdown day 2025, the New York Giants released fan-favorite QB Tommy DeVito, despite an undefeated preseason. The Giants opted to keep three quarterbacks: Russell Wilson as the starter, Jameis Winston as the veteran backup, and rookie Jaxson Dart. DeVito's release highlights the tough decisions teams face, even with popular players.

title: 13-yr dies after eating raw instant noodles: Hidden dangers you need to know
content: A 13-year-old boy in Cairo tragically died after consuming three packets of uncooked instant noodles, leading to acute intestinal problems. The incident has sparked debate about processed foods and viral food trends like the 'Eat Ramen Raw' challenge.

title: Watch: Kiren Rijiju halts convoy to help accident victims in Ladakh
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju halted his convoy on the Srinagar-Leh highway upon witnessing a vehicle plunge into the Drass river in Ladakh. Rijiju shared a video showing him speaking to the injured victims.

title: Kenny Pickett traded by Browns: 'Passed around like candy'; Raiders quarterback battle
content: Cleveland Browns traded quarterback Kenny Pickett to Las Vegas Raiders. The Raiders needed a backup after Aidan O'Connell's injury. Fans reacted positively to Pickett's move. They believe he will benefit from working with coach Pete Carroll. The Raiders are strengthening their quarterback depth behind Geno Smith. This move provides insurance for the upcoming season.

title: Raging Beas waters wash away portion of Manali-Leh highway- videos
content: Himachal Pradesh is grappling with severe flooding and landslides triggered by heavy rainfall, leading to road closures, school shutdowns, and disrupted utilities. The Manali-Leh highway is blocked, and a truck was swept away by floodwaters. Tragically, numerous fatalities and significant financial losses have already occurred due to the relentless downpour, with more heavy rain forecasted.

title: Chess | It’s official! Goa to host FIDE World Cup with Rs 17.5 Cr prize pool
content: Goa will host the FIDE World Cup 2025 from October 31 to November 27, featuring 206 players competing for a $2 million prize and 3 qualifying spots for 2026 Candidates Tournament. This eight-round knockout event marks a significant moment for Indian chess, following recent triumphs like D Gukesh's World Championship and team victories at the Chess Olympiad.

title: Rain fury in J&K: Roads washed away, flood alerts issued; 10 videos show havoc
content: Heavy rainfall in Jammu and Kashmir has triggered flash floods, cloudbursts, and landslides, resulting in three deaths and widespread damage. Rising river levels prompted alerts and evacuations, while landslides disrupted road connectivity. The meteorological department forecasts continued rainfall, warning of further potential disasters across the region.

title: Stunning prediction! Shreyas Iyer can captain India to a World Cup win'
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts a strong comeback for Shreyas Iyer. Iyer was ignored for the Asia Cup 2025 squad. Lobo believes Iyer's horoscope indicates a potential captaincy. He suggests Iyer could lead India to a major tournament victory, possibly a World Cup. Lobo warns selectors against overlooking Iyer's talent.

title: 'Is it time to pause H-1B?' asks US Senator: Ticking clock for Indian students
content: The H-1B visa program, crucial for Indian students and professionals in the US, faces increased scrutiny due to unverified allegations of kickbacks for hiring Indian tech workers. Political figures are questioning the program's future, potentially disrupting the study-to-work pipeline and impacting the Indian IT workforce. This debate is fueled by broader concerns about American jobs and geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Tried to pull BJP's leg': DKS 'apologises' after RSS anthem row; backs Gandhi family
content: DK Shivakumar apologized on Tuesday for reciting the RSS anthem in the Karnataka Assembly, sparking controversy. Khan stated his remarks were intended to tease the BJP and expressed regret if anyone was hurt.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: How much pension will he earn each month?
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, the former Indian Test cricket legend, has retired from international cricket after an illustrious career spanning 103 Test matches. He accumulated 7,195 runs and played a pivotal role in India's batting lineup. The BCCI will provide Pujara with a monthly pension, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cricket.

title: One ball, two sixes, 13 runs! Sanju Samson does the unthinkable ahead of Asia Cup - Watch
content: Sanju Samson's explosive form in the Kerala Cricket League, including a rare achievement of 13 runs in a delivery, has reignited debate about his inclusion in India's Asia Cup squad. The wicketkeeper-batter smashed 89 off 46 balls, continuing his impressive run. While Ajinkya Rahane supports Samson's inclusion, other pundits believes Shubman Gill's return seals his fate, likely keeping him out of the playing XI.

title: 'Didn't expect him to call us thieves': Mamata hits back at PM Modi
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's remarks labeling her party, TMC, as "thieves." Banerjee defended her government's performance, asserting that the state has properly utilized central funds and responded to all queries.

title: Trump’s 50% tariffs: India signals no plans to stop Russia oil trade
content: Indian refiners plan to slightly decrease Russian crude oil imports in the coming weeks. While maintaining energy ties with Moscow, projected purchases will fall from 1.8 million barrels per day to between 1.4 and 1.6 million. The US has criticized India's increased reliance on Russian oil.

title: After blasting Gambhir, ex-India player slams Dhoni - 'He did not like me'
content: Manoj Tiwary has accused MS Dhoni of favoritism, claiming he wasn't backed despite strong performances, including a century. Tiwary suggests Dhoni's preferences influenced team selection, preventing him from securing a consistent place in the playing XI. He expressed his confusion and disappointment, highlighting a perceived lack of support during Dhoni's captaincy.

title: Greater Noida dowry murder: Father of Nikki makes shocking 'signboard' claim
content: Nikki Bhati's father is demanding the demolition of her in-laws' house after she was allegedly murdered for dowry in Greater Noida. He accuses the family of relentless harassment and obstructing her business aspirations, alleging his daughter was set ablaze after dowry demands went unmet. Police have arrested the husband and in-laws, while the NCW condemns the killing.

title: 'Missions to be conducted': PM Modi addresses India's rare earths shortages
content: Prime Minister Modi launched the National Critical Mineral Mission to boost domestic exploration and capacity for rare earth minerals vital for the auto industry. He flagged off Maruti Suzuki’s first BEV, the e-Vitara, for export to 100 countries, highlighting India's growing role in global EV manufacturing.

title: Record! 102-year-old, with heart condition, becomes oldest to climb Mount Fuji
content: Kokichi Akuzawa, a 102-year-old Japanese man with a heart condition, has set a Guinness World Record as the oldest person to climb Mount Fuji. Despite facing health challenges and an earlier fall, he trained rigorously with weekly mountain hikes. Akuzawa completed the ascent over three days, supported by his family, but has no plans to climb again.

title: Fake NRI admissions racket in medical education: The new red lines
content: A massive fake NRI-quota admissions scam exposed by the Enforcement Directorate has revealed how fabricated guardians, forged certificates, and counterfeit notary stamps were used to secure nearly 18,000 medical seats in West Bengal and Odisha. In response, authorities have enforced stricter rules—tightening guardianship definitions, disallowing extended family sponsorship, mandating embassy-issued certificates, and limiting validity to one year to prevent misuse.

title: 'I don't want to be defense only': Trump's new 'department of war' idea
content: President Trump has expressed interest in renaming the Department of Defense to the Department of War, believing the latter conveys a stronger image of American military power. He has criticized the term "Defense" as sounding weak and suggested the change reflects a rejection of political correctness. However, such a change would require congressional approval, given the department's legal foundation.

title: Boney Kapoor moves Madras HC; alleges 3 individuals illegally claiming Sridevi’s property
content: Boney Kapoor has approached the Madras High Court, contesting claims to a Chennai property once owned by his late wife, Sridevi. Kapoor alleges that three individuals are unlawfully asserting ownership, potentially through fraudulent means. He disputes the validity of their claims, particularly questioning a legal heirship certificate issued to them.

title: Sarfaraz Khan on fire! Sends strong message to selectors ahead of Windies Tests
content: Sarfaraz Khan's unbeaten 109 propelled Mumbai against Haryana in the Buchi Babu Tournament, rescuing them from an early collapse. This century follows his earlier 138 against TNCA XI, solidifying his form ahead of the Test season.

title: Happy Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes, greetings and images
content: Ganesh Chaturthi, a major Indian festival, will be celebrated on August 26, 2025. This ten-day festival honors the birth of Lord Ganesha. Devotees will worship idols at home and in public. Lord Ganesha is the god of wisdom, prosperity, and fortune. The festival includes messages, wishes and quotes. People will celebrate with devotion and joy with friends and family.  Read below!

title: Heavy rains lash J&K: Landslides reported at multiple locations; Srinagar highway closed
content: A cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district triggered flash floods, disrupting normal life and closing the Jammu-Srinagar highway. Heavy rainfall caused landslides at multiple locations, halting traffic and damaging homes in Kishtwar, Doda, and Rajouri. Rivers are overflowing, and authorities have issued warnings for continued rainfall and potential hazards.

title: 'He's a hypocrite' - Former India cricketer lambasts Gautam Gambhir - Here's why
content: Former Indian cricketer Manoj Tiwary has strongly criticized head coach Gautam Gambhir, labeling him a "hypocrite" for India's upcoming Asia Cup match against Pakistan. Tiwary highlighted Gambhir's previous stance against playing Pakistan, questioning his current role as coach.

title: Traders bathe in potholes to protest crumbling road in Chhattisgarh - watch
content: Traders in Chhattisgarh's Korba district staged a half-naked protest, bathing in pothole-filled rainwater on the Kusmunda–Imlichapar road to highlight its appalling condition. The monsoon has transformed the road into a hazardous pond, severely disrupting business and causing frequent accidents. Frustrated by government inaction, the traders took this symbolic step to demand immediate repairs.

title: Asia Cup | SKY on his injury status - 'I knew how the recovery is going to be'
content: Suryakumar Yadav recovered from an injury sustained near the end of IPL 2025. He spent weeks at the BCCI Centre of Excellence. There, he underwent a structured rehabilitation process. Yadav praised the facility and staff for their support. He focused on mindset and physical recovery. Now, Suryakumar Yadav is fit.

title: 'Inshallah...': Pakistan bowler warns India ahead of Asia Cup clash in UAE - Watch
content: Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf has stirred the pot ahead of the Asia Cup clash with India, confidently proclaiming victory in both anticipated matches. While Pakistan gears up for the tournament and a preceding tri-series, a surprising squad selection sees Salman Agha appointed captain, with Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan notably absent.

title: 'Obstacles to free trade': German official backs India on Trump tariffs; calls for slashing duties
content: German envoy Georg Enzweiler criticized the US imposition of tariffs on various countries, deeming them "obstacles to free trade." He advocated for minimizing tariffs to promote open commerce.

title: Trump tariff impact: Why is stock market down today? Top 6 reasons
content: Donald Trump tariffs impact on stock market: Indian stock markets plummeted on Tuesday, with the Nifty50 and Sensex taking a hit following the US imposing 50% tariffs on Indian exports. This decision, coupled with profit booking, foreign investment outflows, and a weakening rupee, intensified negative market sentiment.

title: "1 Nation Has Flying F-35, We've Floating F-35": Minister At Warship Launch
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh today commissioned two multi-mission stealth frigates, INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri, at the Eastern Naval Command of the Indian Navy.

title: 65-Year-Old School Cook Sexually Assaults 2 Students In UP, Arrested: Cops
content: A 65-year-old cook at a government primary school in Kursi area of this district has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting two students, police said on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Man Befriends Guard Dogs To Rob Employer Of Over 4 Lakhs As Revenge
content: In a unique case of burglary, a man managed to steal over Rs 4 lakh from a godown in the Najafgarh area by calmly walking past the guard dogs he appeared to have befriended before, officials said on Tuesday.

title: RSS Turns 100: A Look Back At Key Moments In Its History
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, the ideological mentor of the BJP, is celebrating its centenary tomorrow.

title: Ladakh Records Season's First Snowfall, Authorities Warn Of Heavy Rains
content: The high altitude areas of Ladakh, witnessed the season's first snowfall as moderate rain lashed the plains in the Union Territory, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | From Panic To Principle: Why We Need To Rethink The Stray Dog Debate
content: The real, long-term solution to our conflicts with animals is not to build bigger shelters, which are just prisons. It is to begin the difficult work of renegotiating the basic rules of our society.

title: Bodoland Territorial Council Elections On September 22 In Assam
content: Elections to the 40-member Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) in Assam will be held on September 22, State Election Commissioner Ranjan Sarma announced on Tuesday.

title: 9 Killed, Including 5 On Vaishno Devi Route, In Jammu Amid Rain, Landslides
content: Nine people have been killed, including 5 deaths in the Vaishno Devi shrine route, and several people have been injured due to heavy rain in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district.

title: 3 Jharkhand Women Arrested At Kerala Train Station With 24 Kgs Of Cannabis: Cops
content: Three women from Jharkhand were arrested with 24 kilograms of marijuana at Kollam railway station on Tuesday, police said.

title: 4-Year-Old Boy's Face Bitten Off By Stray Dogs In Maharashtra
content: The flesh was coming off his face, his blue T-shirt was black in the middle with the blood having congealed. His eyes were open as he lay on the hospital bed. The four-year-old was attacked by a pack of dogs in Maharashtra.

title: Asia To Africa: Inside Putin's Plan To Export Russian Cyber Capabilities Worldwide
content: As the US and Europe tighten restrictions on Russian tech firms, Moscow is quietly extending its cyber influence across Africa, the Middle East, and Asia, presenting its commercial cybersecurity capabilities as protection against Western interference

title: University In Kerala Launches Dedicated Hostel For Transgender Students
content: For the first time in the state, a hostel exclusively to accommodate transgender students has been opened on the Mahatma Gandhi University campus in Kerala's Kottayam district.

title: "They Call Me President Of...": Trump Boasts As He Criminalises Burning US Flag
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday claimed that European leaders "jokingly" call him the "President of Europe", while speaking at the White House after he signed an Executive Order that makes burning the flag of America a criminal offence.

title: India Is Most Dangerous Country To Take Selfie, US Is Number 2
content: A new study might make you think twice before you grab your camera to take that Instagram-worthy selfie during a trip. With a startling 271 casualties-214 deaths and 57 injuries-India emerged as the deadliest country to take selfies.

title: Trump's Crackdown Gives Immigration Agency Power But Puts It Under Strain
content: Under President Donald Trump, the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency has become the driving force of his sweeping crackdown on migrants.

title: India Gets 2 New Frontline Warships: 10 Points On What Makes Them Special
content: Both warships are follow-on ships of the Project 17 ('Shivalik') class frigates and are largely indigenous, with over 75% of their components being made in India. They were built under Project 17A, or P17A, in which 'A' stands for Alpha.

title: "Smuggled Via Courier": How Hyderabad Busted University Drugs Racket
content: The anti-narcotics sleuths of Elite Action Group for Drug Law Enforcement (EAGLE) Telangana have busted one of the biggest university-linked drug rackets, uncovering the supply and sale of narcotics into educational campuses.

title: Bengal IPS Officer Awarded 3 Years After Daredevil Op Against Armed Robbers
content: Three years after he led a daredevil operation against a gang of robbers armed with sophisticated weapons and high-tech equipment, an IPS officer of West Bengal cadre received a gallantry award this Independence Day.

title: Indian-Origin Dubai Woman To Feature In Times Square Video On Down Syndrome
content: A 22-year-old Indian-origin woman from Dubai will be featured on the giant screens of New York's Times Square on September 6 as part of a global Down syndrome awareness campaign.

title: BJP sees conspiracy to defame Dharmasthala, takes out massive protest march in Dharwad
content: The protestors led by various BJP leaders march from Kadapa Maidan and raise slogans against the conspiracy by vested interests

title: BBMP identifies 264 irreparable potholes in Bengaluru
content: The BBMP has identified 3,995 potholes within its jurisdiction. Among these, the East Zone recorded the highest number with 784, followed by Mahadevapura (638), the South Zone (593), and Bommanahalli (520)

title: Active monsoon conditions likely; yellow alert for nine districts on August 27
content: Moderate to heavy monsoon activity is likely over most parts of the State, except the southernmost districts, during the remaining days of August. Kerala has a 15% shortfall in rainfall during the ongoing southwest monsoon season

title: Arunachal to get city gas distribution network; BPCL, OIL sign agreement to set up JV
content: As a part of the project, CNG stations will be set up and PNG will be supplied to households, commercial units, and industries in the State

title: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann takes a dig at Prime Minister Modi over ‘achhe din’
content: He keeps saying ‘achche din’ (good days) will come. I don’t know when. His have come, ours haven’t, says the Punjab Chief Minister at a Tamil Nadu government function held in Chennai

title: Congress leader K. Muraleedharan slams Kerala govt. for its failure to resolve POABS plantation issue
content: Former KPCC president criticizes Kerala government for neglecting plantation workers’ issues, supports protest against POABS Group in Idukki.

title: Chamundi Hill is not property of Hindus alone, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: The Deputy Chief Minister defends State govt.’s decision to invite Kannada writer Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Dasara festivities atop the hill

title: Yadgir ready for festivities as 1,068 idols, in all, have been allowed to be installed
content: Deputy Commissioner Harshal Bhoyar chairs a peace committee meeting with organisers and others on maintaining peace during celebrations

title: Budameru victims demand permanent solution to recurring floods
content: Members of the United Forum of Budameru Flood Victims will stage a protest, under the leadership of the CPI(M), at Daba Kottu Centre on August 30 and will submit petitions and stage a massive protest at the Collector’s office on September 1

title: YSRCP demands action against MLA for attack on forest officials
content: Coalition government is unable to protect government staff and police personnel, alleges Gorantla Madhav

title: Chief Minister to present awards at IDSFFK closing ceremony on Wednesday
content: Lifetime Achievement Award for outstanding contributions to the field of documentary filmmaking will be presented to acclaimed independent filmmaker Rakesh Sharma

title: Election to Assam’s Bodoland Territorial Council on September 22
content: September 26 has been fixed as the date for counting of votes across the 40 constituencies of the council

title: Ministers discuss UKP third stage plans
content: The government has stated that it is committed to increasing the height of the Almatti dam from the present 519.6 metres to 524.26 metres to help complete the third phase

title: I'm focused on agriculture, farmers welfare, says Chouhan amid buzz he is eying BJP chief post
content: At this moment, agriculture is in every pore of my body, and farmers are in my breath, says Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan

title: Naidu urges timely credit, banking innovation, and support for farmers, MSMEs, and women entrepreneurs
content: At SLBC meet, Chief Minister warns against year-end lending, calls for backing SHGs, incubation centres, and developing Amravati as a financial hub

title: Saudi Arabia and India were biggest buyers of Russian fuel oil in July, data shows
content: Singapore, Turkey and Senegal were also among the top destinations for Russian fuel oil and VGO export supplies last month, LSEG data showed

title: Childless couple cheated of ₹4 lakh by ‘infant selling gang’
content: They lodge complaint at the PGRS; NTR District Collector G. Lakshmisha orders probe, says the case has been entrusted to the Women Development and Child Welfare Department

title: DNA of people living in undivided India for over 40,000 years same: Bhagwat
content: If we have to make the country rise, then it will not happen by leaving the job to someone. Everybody will have a role to play, says RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat

title: Seethathode Kayaking Festival on September 2
content: The event offers prize money totalling ₹3.45 lakh in various categories and competitions will be held in the Moozhiyar river

title: Arrangements in place for Kanipakam Brahmotsavams from August 27
content: Celebrations to continue till September 16; Minister for Endowments Anam Ramanarayana Reddy to present the traditional ‘silk vastrams’ to the presiding deity on behalf of the State government

title: Why RTE Act admissions portal not open in Tamil Nadu even months after the beginning of academic year, asks Madras High Court
content: Justices G.R. Swaminathan and V. Lakshminarayanan express concern over the delay in making admissions in schools under the RTE Act for the current academic year 2025-26

title: Andhra Pradesh forms GoM to chart roadmap for Housing for All
content: Panel of Ministers to address ground-level hurdles, streamline beneficiary selection, and evolve uniform policy on pending housing schemes

title: People must protect their right to vote to safeguard Constitution: Rahul Gandhi
content: BJP leaders are indulging in Vote Chori through the Election Commission… People must come forward to protect their right to vote and also to protect the Indian Constitution, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Govt. employees, pensioners press Centre, State to fulfill their long-pending demands
content: They stage a brief demonstration outside the Tahsildar’s office in Hosapete before submitting a memorandum

title: Jammu and Kashmir rains LIVE: Indian Army undertakes rescue operations in Jammu
content: Reports of damage to nearly a dozen houses and a cowshed were also received from higher reaches of Kishtwar, Doda and Rajouri districts

title: Madras High Court stays order sentencing police officer to three-month imprisonment
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan stay the order passed by a single judge

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Punjab rains: Flood crisis deepens in Kapurthala, evacuation starts in Ferozepur; schools closed across State
content: The Sutlej, Beas and Ravi rivers and seasonal rivulets are in spate because of heavy rainfall in their catchment areas and release of surplus water from the Pong and Bhakra dams

title: 5 killed, 14 injured in landslip on route to Vaishno Devi shrine
content: Rescue operations are underway near the Inderprastha Bhojnalaya at Adhkwari, officials said. The landslip struck at a point about halfway along the winding 12-k.m. trek from Katra to the hilltop shrine

title: One-third school students take private coaching, trend more common in urban areas: Centre's survey
content: The average annual household expenditure on private coaching per student in urban areas (₹3,988) was higher than that in rural areas (₹1,793)

title: Suspension of vigilance court employee over secret recordings sparks row
content: The clandestinely recorded clips included confidential judicial dictations and other official as well as unofficial conversations on different dates

title: What to expect from the 63rd edition of the Bengaluru Ganesh Utsava in 2025
content: The 11-day festival will have musical performances by Vijay Prakash, Raghu Dixit, Rajesh Krishnan, Vijay Yesudas, M.D. Pallavi, and Praveen Godkhindi, as well as along with a food festival and cultural events

title: Jarange firm on quota agitation in Mumbai from August 29; Government's attempt to dissuade him fails
content: The protesters will not disturb the Ganesh festival celebrations in the state capital, he said, appealing to the government to give them a dedicated route to reach the Azad Maidan in south Mumbai, a popular protest site

title: Calcutta University, West Bengal government set for confrontation over exam date
content: The university has refused to postpone an examination scheduled on August 28, the foundation day of the Trinamool Congress students’ wing

title: CID arrests prime accused in Shivaprakash murder case in Delhi airport
content: Police claim that Jagadisha is a gangster and an associate of Byrathi Basavaraj, BJP MLA representing K.R. Puram in Bengaluru

title: Akhilesh meets Opposition V-P pick Sudershan Reddy, terms September 9 polls 'fight for justice'
content: In the current political scenario, what better option can there be than a judge to lead this battle for justice? We are confident that those who value justice will listen to their inner voice and vote in his favour, says Akhilesh Yadav

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy joins Rahul Gandhi’s Yatra in Bihar
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee (TPCC) president B. Mahesh Kumar Goud and others joined the Yatra

title: Atham pageantry heralds Onam in Kerala with artistic fervour, social messages
content: Athachamayam procession, organised annually by Thripunithura municipality, showcases Kerala’s rich artistic and cultural heritage along with the State’s celebrated secular spirit

title: Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar inspects pothole filling work in Bengaluru, urges citizens to report on ‘gundi gamana’ app
content: The DCM said that MLAs had brought up the pothole problem frequently and added that the civic authority has employed novel measures, including monitoring potholes through a public-centred app called ‘gundi gamana’, to expedite repairs

title: INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri commissioned by Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at Visakhapatnam
content: The commissioning of Udaygiri and Himgiri underscores the growing maritime importance of India’s eastern seaboard

title: Three students injured as government school window lintel collapses at Devanahalli near Bengaluru, plaint against Bharat Electronics Limited
content: The headmaster of the school has filed a complaint against the Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL), which constructed the building under a Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiative

title: Quinn Hughes, Cale Makar lead defenseman ratings in NHL 26
content: Quinn Hughes of the Vancouver Canucks has been crowned the most stalwart defender with 95 OVR . the american is among the top five highest-rated athletes in the entire game . Zach Werenski , Roman Josi , Victor Hedman , and Rasmus Dahlin are chasing the top 20 .

title: College Football Playoff 2025: G5 contenders lead preseason bubble watch
content: the first and last top-25 rankings of the season will be the inclusion of a conference champion in the top 12 . the Broncos have the highest chance to reach the playoff (25%) of any G5 team . Boise State coach Spencer Danielson met with his players and reminded them that they weren't ranked at all .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material as you prepare to make the best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot at a championship.

title: 'Transitions take time': How things are different for Kalen DeBoer in Year 2 at Alabama
content: "it was basically the elephant in the room," says a team meeting . "if you don't want to be here, leave," says the team's head strength coach . a meeting in which coach David Ballou spared nobody in an earsplitting tirade .

title: From Tennessee to UCLA, Nico Iamaleava is getting a fresh start close to home
content: Nico Iamaleava's transfer to UCLA could reinvigorate its football program . the 20-year-old quarterback barely reacts, but his soft-spoken demeanor does not give away much . he speaks of the appeal of UCLA, the chance to be home an american .

title: MMA divisional rankings: How big of a boost did victory give Aljamain Sterling?
content: aljamain Sterling had a sizable obstacle to overcome when a featherweight fight was shifted to a 153-pound catchweight . Ortega was unable to weigh in at the original 146-pound limit . he was fought at a full 18 pounds more than the weight he used to have to hit .

title: Why Washington's offense is the big winner in Terry McLaurin's new deal
content: new: a former assistant coach says the deal needed to get done . new: the real money on the new deal won't be known until the three-year deal . the deal is expected to be announced on monday . it's unclear who won the contract extension .

title: How the Fever and four other WNBA teams can clinch playoff spots
content: the 2025 WNBA playoff picture is taking shape . the top teams in the league are fighting for playoff seeding and home-court advantage . five teams, all within four games of each other, are realistically vying for the final three spots .

title: Was approached to favour a party: Tribunal judge opts out of insolvency case
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Is Gladbach the place to boost Reyna's career?
content: the 22-year-old is in desperate need of a fresh start . he is plagued by injuries and inconsistency in the past four seasons . the american earned just 342 minutes in the previous Bundesliga season .
